2467449694@chatroom           11/29/2016 10:35:52      痞子钢人                 wxid_u866ihwi4gkt12      Receive             Text                @大年 我们公司我知道的ingestion into Hadoop 有几种，Hadoop或其它并行系统到Hadoop用自己写的mapreduce或node到nodepipe thru. Thruput可以很大。app或operational data stores用Kafka，rdbms 用类似sqoop。
2467449694@chatroom           11/29/2016 14:07:30      Dandelion                wxid_wak4ebk9cpdh12      Receive             Text                The latency problem seems inevitable. 30 minutes 是我们平常做的ball park estimate：Data ingestion process only ingests raw data into Hadoop; then data needs to go through data quality checking, data cleansing and validation process 等等， 这个过程不管用什么run（even SPARK）也需要大约15分钟左右；然后data transformation and loading data into ML or ES, that will take another 15 minutes or so；如果中间还需要generate snapshot data，那就更需要时间了。Kafka是messaging，sqoop一般用于一次性move data（on going 如果schema改变了job 就会 fail）。另外ECG， sftp 也很常用于provision data，或者干脆build 一些APIs on the top of ML canonical model

2467449694@chatroom           11/29/2016 15:37:42      Dandelion                wxid_wak4ebk9cpdh12      Receive             Text                Hive view retrieve data很慢，而且Hive 有局限，read-only，做data enrichment根本不行。再说支持Hive的Hbase 要define row key很tricky，我们通常一个query要run几小时。不过Hive view + ORC format会提高速度。总的说来，HDFS是好写难读
2467449694@chatroom           11/29/2016 15:42:36      Dandelion                wxid_wak4ebk9cpdh12      Receive             Text                在这里也是要学习大家经验怎么solution real time Hadoop Integration，每次算完latency就心里哇凉哇凉的，每个hops都是一个delay，不加hop又不能保证data质量data速度，到处都是trade offs

2467449694@chatroom           12/11/2016 09:53:36      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                @王曉川 面试方向不一样，这是我的感受。现在西海岸主流公司像FLAG，技术面试以刷题为主，也就是leetcode，否则估计第一关都过不去，在双城地区就不同了，在本地我只面试过一个要刷题的公司。你如果没有听过leetcode可以上网先刷两道easy的，试试深浅，只有两方面内容，数据结构和算法。现在老印也刷题。
2467449694@chatroom           12/11/2016 09:54:49      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                刷题一遍需要比较长时间，根据个人基础不同，3个月至6个月很常见，基本上不刷两遍就不要去面试Google了。
2467449694@chatroom           12/11/2016 09:58:24      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                所以不管你是资深人士还是初出校门，不刷完medium题目，又想做Google engineer是没有希望的，你如果要做PM，同样要刷题，只要easy的就够了，这是我的朋友，从明州seagate搬到加州的朋友最近跟我说的，就是刷题进入的Google，没有内部referral。
2467449694@chatroom           12/11/2016 10:07:39      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                所以对老人来说，难度就大了。我那朋友说如果职位是搞基础软件，刷题还算有用，如果是搞应用软件，刷题看不出水平。近代搞应用软件的很少再考虑算法了，主要看谁能多块好省地搞定 domain. 让你 Sort product item,  谁还 bubble sort？
2467449694@chatroom           12/11/2016 10:09:41      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                @王曉川 如果进FLAG，可能天天需要用，我们做application很少用到

2467449694@chatroom           12/18/2016 20:32:37      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                先上几道小菜，夜宵再上   Spring Boot -  aims to make it easy to create Spring-powered, production-grade applications and services with minimum fuss.    Spring Data  - provide a level of abstraction to the underlying data stores of many Sql or NoSql.   Spring Data Rest - helps you expose your domain entities directly as RESTful endpoints as HATEOAS.   Spring Rest Docs - use of tests to produce the documentation to ensures that the documentation generated always accurately matches the actual behavior of the API   Lombok - help us to reduce boilerplate code and create getter, setters, toString, constructor, equals and hashCode methods automatically and let developers focus on business code.   Neo4j  - delivers the lightning-fast read and write performance you need, while still protecting your data integrity.   JMockit - a more powerful unit test tool that can test constructor, final method, static method and almost anything.   FluentLenium - helps you writing readable, reusable, reliable, and resilient UI functional tests for web browse.   Cucumber -  It runs automated acceptance tests written in a behavior-driven development (BDD) style   Dropwizard metrics - provides a powerful toolkit of ways to measure the behavior of critical components in your production environment.   ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) - is a powerful and freely available log management solution.    
2467449694@chatroom           12/18/2016 20:33:27      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                这是今晚会分享的 technology stack. 和选它们的 Thought process
2467449694@chatroom           12/18/2016 20:35:31      huigang                  wxid_4baic6gkdvdh12      Receive             Text                还是音频吗？
2467449694@chatroom           12/18/2016 20:39:53      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                对还是音频，我会后整理

2467449694@chatroom           12/20/2016 19:21:17      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                @huigang 在等晓川回答的同时，我试着汇报一下我昨晚学习的内容，因为我们项目中我被分配到的任务恰好是research neo4j，用下面几个slides解释一下。首先数据结构不同，neo4j是graph

2467449694@chatroom           12/20/2016 20:54:39      huigang                  wxid_4baic6gkdvdh12      Receive             Text                @王军 got it,谢谢
2467449694@chatroom           12/20/2016 22:27:24      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                很高兴大家对 GraphDB like Neo4J 感兴趣，我把以前的一些 Tech Design 的 rationale 总结一下
2467449694@chatroom           12/20/2016 22:27:29      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                graph databases don't suffer join pain because they express relationships at a fundamental level. That is, relationships physically exist on disk and they are named, directed, and can be themselves decorated with properties (this is called the property graph model, see: https://github.com/tinkerpop/blueprints/wiki/Property-Graph-Model). This means if you chose to, you could look at the relationships on disk and see how they "join" entities. Relationships are therefore first-class entities in a graph database and are semantically far stronger than those implied relationships reified at runtime in a relational store.   Graph databases are much faster than relational databases for connected data - a strength of the underlying model. A consequence of this is that query latency in a graph database is proportional to how much of the graph you choose to explore in a query, and is not proportional to the amount of data stored, thus defusing the join bomb.Graph databases make modelling and querying much more pleasant meaning faster development and fewer WTF moments. For example expressing friend-of-friend for a typical social network in Neo4j's Cypher query language is just MATCH (me)-[:FRIEND]->()-[:FRIEND]->(foaf) RETURN foaf.
2467449694@chatroom           12/20/2016 22:36:02      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Capella University 系统的跳战是 Course, Curriculum  的 Domain Entities 的关联非常复杂。Neo4J 的强处是处理数据关联。当时也有同事问 Domain 关联的复杂性是不是由于 relation database 的 model 做得不好？也有这可能。但 dB modeler 是两个加起有二十年经验的 DBA 摸索出来的，也尽了全力。如果 refactor dB model, 我们没有信心会搞得更好。那就堵 Neo4J 了。

2467449694@chatroom           12/23/2016 15:09:16      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                @王军 @Xiwen   @RepositoryRestResource(collectionResourceRel = "people", path = "people") public interface PersonRepository extends MongoRepository<Person, String> { // Allow GET /people/:id @Override @RestResource(exported = true) public Person findOne(String id); // Allow GET /people @Override @RestResource(exported = true) public Page<Person> findAll(Pageable pageable); // Prevents POST /people and PATCH /people/:id @Override @RestResource(exported = false) public Person save(Person s); // Prevents DELETE /people/:id @Override @RestResource(exported = false) public void delete(Person t); }
2467449694@chatroom           12/23/2016 15:10:14      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                上面这 snippet 就 open get, close post

2467449694@chatroom           12/27/2016 13:32:08      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                根据你的问题，可能我没有完全了解你项目的要求，但是似乎你要一个非常flat的schema，也就是denormalized data，这个就很适合nosql database，但是看你是不是需要acid，nosql database大部分不能实现传统意义的acid，有些像neo4j可以，但是用途是处理比较复杂的relationship用的，听起来不太适合你的项目。
2467449694@chatroom           12/27/2016 13:34:39      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                可能需要进一步了解你的这部分是要做什么，根据你第一段的描述，你在做的就是典型的denormalization，也就是把关系型的数据变成线性的数据。
2467449694@chatroom           12/27/2016 14:02:59      EVZ                      wxid_1sw4loax684h12      Receive             Text                @王军 这是我过去做过的一个项目 的确有data 专家做了很多 denormalization 他做完以后我根据优化后的 sql statement 开发search framework. 就是为了提高搜索性能 但是使用大量的 join 但是这些join可以使用最左边的key 以及这个key所在table 的一些schema. 搜索的结果可以mapping到front end. 一个query 每次返回大约5000 results， 不是很多
2467449694@chatroom           12/27/2016 14:10:49      EVZ                      wxid_1sw4loax684h12      Receive             Text                这些 join 的目的反映出BO, 如果每个table 都mapping成BO的话 处理这BO 势必会影响性能 现在很想了解和学习一下 nosql 如何实现或替代关系型数据库join功能
2467449694@chatroom           12/27/2016 14:26:02      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                目前nosql尤其是document store解决join两种方法，nested doc和 parent child

2467449694@chatroom           12/27/2016 19:42:36      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                @Eva Zhong 刚才仔细看了你现在的SQL部分，说用了最左边的key，这个我有点不是太理解，你为了提高搜索性能不一定非要用PK，只要你的join和where clause有合理的index就好了，听起来是需要tuning，看你的query到底join了多少table？群里有专业dba，可以帮着出主意。

2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 08:54:06      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                @王曉川 谢谢！我们又可以一起学习和探讨！我个人认为big data 系列technology 尤其是Hadoop, spark, storm, flink, 提供了一个新的写程以及运行的模式。这个模式下，即使一个刚刚开始写程序的都可以解决一些以前很难解决的问题，尤其scalability, availability.  在实际应用中，主要是适应过程。那还是胆量。第一问题是：真有scalability challenge? 有，新手就可以解决了，那老手怎办？

2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 09:01:59      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                请教两个问题，目前big data还是主要解决data analytics的问题对吗？主要的transaction还是传统RDBMS？换句话说big data system都是consume其他上游系统的数据？
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 09:04:11      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                第二个，像你提到这是一个完全不同方法的编程或者解决问题的方式，比如machine learning，在你们金融领域，ML用的普遍吗？比如tensor flow？适用于哪些场合？
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 09:08:06      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                关于scalability，big data我理解是解决了传统RDBMS的不可以horizontal scalable的问题，但不一定没有performance的问题，所以新手可以随便提出一个可以scalable的架构，是不是能满足真正production要求呢？根据你们的实战经验谈谈？
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 09:10:36      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                能给你们在实际应用中采用的架构吗？用哪部分做什么？
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 10:06:27      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                Excellent questions!  对，主要的transactions 以及一些Big data systems 的重要results 还是在传统的RDBMS.  老手还是多于新手[Smile]。主要是现有的系统太厐大都只认RDBMS.  Big Data 系统是想解决所有的问题。当然data analytics 是其中的一个主要要解决的问题。对一些主要的共需问题，spark 提供一些modules or tools, 像，SQL, MLib, GraphX. ML 尤其deep learning 在很多领域都非常成功。那用ML就可以预测金融市场了。ML自己寻找规律。好多hedge funds 都试过。现在好像还没有出现几个由于ML的billionaire.  我们主要用ML在新闻以及用户行为分析。至于实际架构可以是五花八门：好比要求实时或者低延迟就用Storm。当然我们说用Storm，实际内部用了很多东西，主要有Kafka, flatbuffer, redid, 还有一些关键的offheap memory 的应用。这可能就需要老手了。
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 13:06:04      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                @Jeff Hu 多谢解答，我问一个纯粹外行的问题，（本来就是外行）你提到realtime用storm，storm和spark是竞争的产品吗？还有数据存储的数据库现在流行的是什么？我只听过HBase和Hive，现在大数据的vendor市场比例什么样的？horton works, Cloudera, databricks etc.

2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 16:23:15      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                @王军 我们都是外行。这个领域大家都是外行。可以这么说吧，Storm 和Spark Streaming 是竞争产品。但是，真正realtime 只能用Storm since the nature of micro-batching hurts Spark streaming. Nosql 数据库正如你说的hbase.  OpenTSDB 也是用hbase 作为backend.  比较有名的还有Cassandra, MongoDB. Vendors 还是在设法用新的方法来抓住客户，要不open source 不好维持下去. Ambari 就是Hortonworks用来抓住客户或者说integration 产品。
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 16:37:06      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                @大年 我想如果仅仅是integration 没有scalability issues, 那么Hadoop／Spark 没有太大优势。主要还是看有没有distributed computing 的需求。同时具体问题有不同解决办法。现在大部分难题还在如何realtime来处理或者integrate/analyze massive data from multiple data sources with various formats. 
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 16:50:44      大年                     wxid_7r2kos7r4qx112      Receive             Text                @Jeff Hu 一语中的！Last part is exactly one of our struggles. Good to know we are not alone. Thanks again! [Shake]
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 17:43:31      Jack Zhang               wxid_gipunypov4k022      Receive             Text                In this case, a traditional data warehouse and a big data hybrid approach seems to work.
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 17:46:24      Jack Zhang               wxid_gipunypov4k022      Receive             Text                Namely, build a data model to answer expected analytical questions, including some summarized data from big data, like twitter spice, etc. store all original data in a big data platform, Hadoop.
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 17:52:06      Jack Zhang               wxid_gipunypov4k022      Receive             Text                You always need tools and programming to integrate data and perhaps save temporary results. Data Scientist need 1. To know data and company business to decide what questions to ask, 2. To do hands on to process all relevant data to seeking new findings. 3. To able to communicate new findings ( tell a new story) to business/decision makers and be able to engage good discussion about new findings.

2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 18:54:13      Jack Zhang               wxid_gipunypov4k022      Receive             Text                There may be multiple layer questions: if your analytical tool or data warehousing is already in place, you do not need to replace it. If you want to put new health care data in Hadoop to facilitate future data integration, it may make sense to put it in Hadoop. Not many companies are ready to  move all data warehousing data to Hadoop in day one until new skill set is ready available for majority of  it employees and new tools is stable and meet all needs.

2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 19:21:06      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                我斗胆说一句看法，没有啥绝对的structure data，看你怎么model，health care之所以@大年 认为highly structured，是因为行业标准，比如EDI837，而大数据之所以“大”，除了近年social media信息量的爆炸，另一个原因是因为denormalized，Flat out data，同样的信息在NoSQL里占用存储空间大，不知道这样理解对不对。当年的RDBMS因为关系结构，节省空间优势明显，但来到今天反而这优点不是我们关心的了
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 19:40:40      Jack Zhang               wxid_gipunypov4k022      Receive             Text                There are tools to do near real time data warehousing, but most shop do batch process nightly. ODS is a concept that is almost like a application, namely, speed and minimal data stored for performance. To do near real time, you also need to work with the sources system to see which tool fit, an  architect work 
2467449694@chatroom           12/29/2016 19:47:24      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                That sounds like what we were doing for data warehousing in my previous company, my current near real time search project using sql trigger insert message in a queue mechanism (Kafka or Sql service broker), then index json doc into elastic. The latency is index time+ potential queue lag, default setting for elastic is 1 second. I am happy with result from poc so far.

2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 10:58:24      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                @Eva Zhong 新年快乐，问题越具体越好，这样群里的人才能更有效帮忙。我可能需要你再仔细描述一下你的问题。nosql不建议创建更多“table”，如果有关系的数据，把它们都nested in same document，我assume用的是document store。上次记得你的问题可能是SQL performance tuning问题，不一定非要用nosql解决。
2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 11:03:28      EVZ                      wxid_1sw4loax684h12      Receive             Text                @王军 新年快乐 不是有啥performance 问题 是想起过去做过的一个 rdb search 项目 自己觉得很经典哈[Joyful]如果转成noSql db 会怎么样？

2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 11:23:50      EVZ                      wxid_1sw4loax684h12      Receive             Text                @王军 1-2 分钟根据不同search statements. 有的join up to 20-30 tables 是不是跟nosql比太忙了 但是每个record 类似pojo 处理business part很容易 而且每个search statements 可以自动产生根据需要的查询 因为不懂noSql db 设计想不出来 nosql能否做得这么简单 除了速度有可能慢点

2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 14:24:40      吴珂                     F1234191312              Receive             Text                补充一下，我现在用swagger editor 来edit API design document in YAML file，基本上项目开发前期不仅JSON format在文件中俢改，EDM- entity data module也在yaml文件定义，以及spring base level 及 data connection configuration在editor中编辑定义。我们自己framework integrated with Swagger to take yaml file generate API and abstract source code, 比较快push到developer 进行开发；而且每次设计变化可以修改yaml regenerate core files, 不会太多影响business layer, documents generated with code, 的确节省好多时间

2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 19:05:25      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                好话题！Docker 和Kafka 都是好东东。今天还没用上的话，过不了一些时候，大家都会用的。Swarm 的设想是，今后大家只需用docker 系列的产品就解决cluster 和VM 所要解决的一切问题。不再需要了解VM, ansible, chef, kubernetes, 等诸多东西(现在docker 表面上支持所有)。 另一个更极端的方向就是刚刚前面说amazon lambda,  大家都到我amazon lambda/API系统里写程就好了，不用再想server / docker 之类的问题了。Kafka 取代了所有message queue 以及一系列的问题和产品选择。一统天下。

2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 21:43:31      Xiwen                    wxid_ondjajrg4r9q52      Receive             Text                @王曉川 thanks!
2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 22:15:07      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                @王曉川 可以这么说。Kafka 的主要优点在于Kafka 本身的simple design : completely separating a producer from consumers via a simple log file.  So for producer side there is zero concern about any consumer.  It will not be impacted by any slow consumer.  At the same time, for a consumer, each consumer keeps its own offset and get data on its own pace, any point, multiple times whatever including replays.  Only downside is latency.  However, it is only less than a hundred microseconds relatively, which is ok for most network usage.
2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 22:26:06      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                那 Kafka 就是真的可以取代很多昂贵的IBM shop 那一传统的 Websphere JMS + MQ Series .
2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 22:27:34      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                怪不得以前一堆专门搞 MQ Series 的人都不知跑那里去了
2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 22:28:59      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                不是！更好！大大减少production outages!
2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 22:34:49      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                而且还是 open source。几乎免费
2467449694@chatroom           01/03/2017 22:55:08      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                Docker mainly took the advantage of new Linux features, mainly cgroups (2007) or resource isolation. 简单地说主要好处是在Docker 把operating system 装进你的应用程序。这样，每个程序都在自己的server 上运行。never worry about any unexpected changes in the system.  这一点像VM，一个应用一个VM。 但是overhead小些。至于production monitoring, say you current infrastructure depends on log files.  All you need to do is to create a Docker nameless volume mapping volume to host directory using -v argument for 'docker run' command. Then, anything in that mapped directory accessed/written inside Docker for log or anything else will be treated as normal host files and directories.  Production monitoring is then working as usual for this host directory. Docker is just an application.

2467449694@chatroom           01/04/2017 17:25:29      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                @Winnie I'm just curious about the uses of passing these large files around.  What we would do in this case is to have one application processes the incoming files, save them to databases, and send derived messages (in different topics) via Kafka to anyone interested.  This way, whole system can quickly react to these messages from the file, and only process only interested.  Mainly it is about latency and CPU usage concerns.  However, sending large files via Kafka is absolutely fine.

2467449694@chatroom           01/04/2017 17:36:44      Dandelion                wxid_wak4ebk9cpdh12      Receive             Text                @Jeff Hu 谢谢你哎，你是大拿哦[Salute][Salute]
2467449694@chatroom           01/04/2017 17:42:19      Jeff Hu                  wxid_xiqddfo8tjvj11      Receive             Text                不好意思，共同学习了。再回到Kafka和其他MQ。问题的本质还是在design.  目前还没有比Kafka 更合理的design.  说起来很简单，做起来更简单：Kafka separates/decouples producers from consumers completely.  Completely is the key. 这样在出任何问题时好处理。分公明确。通常的reviews 会说Kafka is producer-centric while rabbitMQ is broker-centric.  RabbitMQ or traditional MQs focus on delivery guarantee between producers and consumers, which is impossible to be achieved anyhow. The trick is the Kafka does not guarantee anything. Kafka keeps messages for 7 days by default.  If you miss anything ask again.  You know the best about yourself.  You are the king.
2467449694@chatroom           01/04/2017 17:45:10      汤棣                     wxid_r3uw5u152ug212      Receive             Text                @王军 @Winnie need to be approved by client, but will definitely considering elastic

2467449694@chatroom           01/04/2017 17:49:09      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                @Jeff Hu 对 guarantee 的点评王道! 吃过MQ Series苦哭的漂过[ThumbsUp][ThumbsUp][ThumbsUp]

You can change the parameters to 1 month or 1 year.  Read as often as you want just reset your own offset. They are in regular files.

2467449694@chatroom           01/07/2017 08:49:32      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                分享一个和 IT 相关的话题。前几天参加了两个 Tech Meetup, 一百多号人里就见到三个女士。这一行业真的就是 Male Dominated 的行业。关键是在我工作中有幸合作过的四个女程序员，每一个都非常能干。但为什么这个行业很难吸引下一代的 ABC 女孩？ Wayzata science Olympic team 里好几个女孩编程很有 raw talent. 有时候和她们聊，都没有将来学工的打算。美国教育近年来提畅 STEM，看来还有很长的路要走。将来的软件开发会越来越高层，会越来越多的用到形象思维，这点女性有很大优势。哈佛，斯坦福在引导女生进入计算机行业就做得非常好。我知道的就有几个女孩子爱上技算就是上了这两个学校的计算机入门课。可以想象教课的老师水平有多高。教书，育才，指路,导航!
2467449694@chatroom           01/07/2017 08:50:17      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                分享一朋友的感发  哈佛的CS毕业生   听到在硅谷工作多年的朋友老周的亲身经历： 老周在硅谷一家大名鼎鼎的公司工作，前年公司调集精兵干将成立了个组搞新产品研发，同时招入了五个CS本科应届毕业生：两个MIT，一个Stanford， 一个卡耐基，一个哈佛，其中来自哈佛的是个ABC女孩，相貌平平，虽然她技术面试也是从一大批优秀的申请者中胜出的，但一开始在五人当中肯定是排名靠后的，让人感觉弱些，长话短说，这个女孩特别虚心好学，慢慢不到一年技术上成为五人中中上，另辟思路解决实际问题的能力和讨论协调工作的能力尤其突出，与上上下下组内组外的同事都很谈得来，几乎每天都收到她发的工作邮件，说事清晰明了周到善于总结，公司很喜欢，肯定把她当作 product manager的苗子来培养。。老周找机会和她聊过几次，她毕业于公立高中（Valedictorian），得过总统奖，数学很棒但高中除上课外基本没编过程序，从没弄过USACO竞赛，上哈佛是准备学医的，在上了CS入门课后才开始对CS感兴趣，最后一发不可收拾不顾父母的反对学了CS，她在哈佛还是校刊的编辑，老周找到拜读了她的几篇文章，很有思想。这个ABC女孩偏民主党，支持AA，老周专门问她对亚裔入藤校门槛高怎么看，她不认为有歧视，认为照顾家境不好的少数民族学生是应该的，估计也没多想过。。过节前听说她以前实习的老板做Startup要拉她入伙，也不知她会不会去，她要是不走肯定是要被提拔的

2467449694@chatroom           01/07/2017 12:54:51      太空飞鹰Endi             taikongfeiying           Receive             Text                我觉得对于绝大多数软件，尤其是功能性模块软件，开不开源并不重要，能够直接当做砖头来简单地应用才是发展的主流，因为用户根本没有时间去关心它怎么做出来的，而开源，说白了就是你还是想搞清楚源代码，自己要花精力脑力去思考思考修改修改，这应该成不了主流，对于软件行业来说。现代社会的飞速发展，应该是直接利用既有成果，也即资源进行组合创新
2467449694@chatroom           01/07/2017 12:56:55      太空飞鹰Endi             taikongfeiying           Receive             Text                最好是直接拿既有资源(砖头，木块...)搭积木，再也不用看到任何计算机语言[Grin]

Through this course, you will also gain an understanding of major concepts in cloud computing, and become familiar with leading cloud computing services such as Amazon Web Services (AWS).

2467449694@chatroom           01/11/2017 22:32:10      明州华人IT群             2467449694@chatroom      Receive                                 
2467449694@chatroom           01/12/2017 00:58:47      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                转国内一社交媒体群主的感言  几天下来，大家对小程序应该有一点感觉了： 1、已有的大体量app比如美团、娱票儿、摩拜做小程序，基本就是一个迷你版。对于这些已经有大规模体量的公司来说，小程序不是一个突破点，而更像是一个具有政治意义的防御点。 2、早期的内容类app做小程序，可以带来新的增长空间，不过app基本上会被卸载，请做好准备。 3、线下铺二维码激活小程序的打法，看起来主要还是大公司玩的转。对于门店打二维码做小程序，除非是连锁门店，或者套用现成模版，否则看起来没那么划算。 4、小程序商店没那么大红利，因为识别二维码被锁死。 5、智能机时代起来的app，很多并没有pc时代的软件或网站，这是真正的智能机一代。同理，复制app的小程序并不需要太看好，真正的爆款应该是app中没出现过的。 6、好玩、实用，仍是第一生产力。 7、一开始的流量不会有想象中那么高，全民小程序还没出现，不过别着急，app刚出来也是这样。第一波小程序，很快会出现一个下行曲线。 8、但是微信真该好好想想利益分享机制的问题，开发成本在那里，获客成本看起来没那么明显压低，小程序和消息流的切换仍被诟病，那么除了大公司、那些小创业者凭什么为你做事呢？ 9、还记得公众号刚出来时，头半年也被嗤之以鼻，因为传播能力根本赶不上微博大v吗？

2467449694@chatroom           01/26/2017 21:36:03      jing                     wxid_q3nj8axe7cvz22      Receive             Text                什么时候拜年 大年三十是有讲究的吧~~ 什么时候可以开始拜年~ 过了三十就是新年好了.. wxjizm1988 | 浏览 5237 次 推荐于2016-04-07 15:53:18 最佳答案 　　拜年的传统正确时间应该是除夕零点以后，这个时候新的一年真正开始大家互相祝贺，而早于零点就属于拜早年，而这个时候新年并未到来拜年显得有点敷衍，如果晚于正月初十就属于晚年了，这个时候新年的喜庆气息已经淡去，早年和晚年都属避免遗憾的应急或补救性质，民间有谚语：“有心拜年十五不晚。

2467449694@chatroom           01/28/2017 19:55:41      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                @Xiwen At JPA landscape,  many to many table is just a junction to associate both side. This middle guy should be as stupid simple as possible. So as Jun suggest, take out extra columns, model them in different table.
2467449694@chatroom           01/28/2017 20:01:20      10000                    10000                    Receive             System info         "王曉川" has recalled a message.
2467449694@chatroom           01/28/2017 20:02:00      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                If you try to expose resources with many to many relations with other resource as Rest JSON,  it will be extremely ugly because JSON does not like bi direction reference.  So it is important to keep many to many relation as simple as possible. If can be avoid, then avoid.
2467449694@chatroom           01/28/2017 23:46:49      Xiwen                    wxid_ondjajrg4r9q52      Receive             Text                @王曉川 Thank you so much!  May it be a good idea to split a many-to-many relationship into 2 many-to-one relationships, as we typically do in relational database design?
2467449694@chatroom           01/28/2017 23:56:24      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                @Xiwen most case, you can do it this way, but in some cases, the business domain is truly many to many, then you have to deal with it brutally. for example, most security model involve many to many relations among user, role, and privilege.

2467449694@chatroom           01/30/2017 10:38:05      太空飞鹰Endi             taikongfeiying           Receive             Text                有一农夫，秋收时不慎将一口袋高梁倒入水缸中，数日后缸内飘出异香，农夫惊诧。 这时，过来一仙风道骨的长者，告诉农夫，你缸内要出琼浆玉液了。但是你得按照我吩咐的去做。农夫忙问，如何去做？ 长者说，明天你要想法找到三个人，每人给缸内滴一滴血，方可。 于是，第二天一早农夫在大街上等人。一会儿，过来一个文人，风度翩翩，农夫说明所求之事。文人慨然应允，给滴了一滴血。时近中午，又过来一个武将，也给滴了一滴血。下午，路上一直没人，等到酉时，天已昏黑。过来一个疯子。农夫无奈只好让疯子滴了一滴血。此时，缸内突然飘出奇异的香味，尝之，醇香溢口，清凉甘冽。农夫于是在缸上做个记号，写了个酉时的酉字，点了三个点，意思是那三个人的三滴血，于是就有了酒字。 时至今日，喝酒之人，一开始文质彬彬，是享受那个文人的气质，喝到中途，意气风发，斗志昂扬，表现的是武将的风范。喝到最后，语无伦次，体面全无，就是让那个疯子的血作怪的！ [Chuckle][Chuckle][Chuckle] 爱悠悠，恨悠悠 小酒一喝晃悠悠 新年已至，美酒佳肴，送给群里爱喝酒的IT男们！！！ [Grin]

2467449694@chatroom           02/11/2017 14:57:22      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                最先是 PhoneGap, 基于 Web 技术，但复杂界面的滑移效果不够流畅。又出了 xamarin，Titanium 技术，把 C#, JavaScript 写的程序 build 成 Native Object C, Java 程序，再构筑成 iOS, Android app,  提供了满意的滑移效果，更重要的是实现了 single code base 的 cost effective delivery.
2467449694@chatroom           02/11/2017 15:03:08      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                以上是2012 年移动应用的状态。Native app, Hybrid app 的最大挑战是 time to market,  改一点小错，就得提交候申，不 Agile. 如果是 Mobile web, 改进起来敏捷快速。  目前手机 browser 越来越强大，HTML5 也越来越完善，moblie web 应该越来越流行。这是我个人的观点

2467449694@chatroom           02/11/2017 18:27:12      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                这样，上线后，如果有重要缺陷的话，老板站在你身后的话，你就可以在后端马上改好，不用再向苹果，谷歌申请 App

They will have a solid understanding of application development technologies and work mostly on the front end designing and building something from end to end. These engineers will primarily end up in product, ads, mobile, platform or growth teams... but these types of skills can be applicable in almost any team in E. Systems Generalist: those who develop the general components on which the website and products are built. These types of candidates will be proficient in writing code to solve large scale backend problems and be less inclined towards dealing with front end development. The ideal candidate can write code in (but not limited to) C, C++, PHP and Python with strong experience in a Linux environment.

2467449694@chatroom           02/15/2017 14:46:12      Xiwen                    wxid_ondjajrg4r9q52      Receive             Text                万能的群， need help with URL rewriting for a website, e.g., http://www.mysite.com:  The website is running at an Apache HTTP server while having files stored in an aws S3 bucket. When a user of the website reaches for a file, he/she is directed to the file in the S3 bucket, for example, http://bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/file. However, I want to hide the S3 URL of the file, instead, display a URL like http://www.mysite.com/file the user’s browser, as if the file is being served directly from my website. I know it is pretty easy to do URL rewriting between two internal paths within the same Apache HTTP server (e.g., /path1 and /path2) using RewriteRule or ProxyPass, but I am not able to do between an internal URL and an external one (e.g., /file and http://bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/file).  Any idea?

2467449694@chatroom           03/06/2017 11:33:25      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                关于学习，我把我的谬论再发一次，本群学习有两种，education 和training，在我的字典里怎么区分？今天学了下礼拜能用上的叫training，其他的叫education。学习的网站有好几个，training大家公认的是pluralsight，教育的有coursera，udemy等等。学习的最好的方法是什么？是做presentation，把自己学的给别人讲出来，讲的时候，你很清楚自己那里明白，哪里还没有真的明白，这就是我的初衷，谬论完毕。

2467449694@chatroom           03/06/2017 12:51:39      Jennifer Huang           wxid_vxp182mn5gmi22      Receive             Text                人工智能 做深度学习的人工智能博士生，现在一毕业就能拿到200到300万美金的年收入的offer，这是有史以来没有发生过的。当然我觉得硅谷的公司都在追捧这个方向，而且基本是四大名校：斯坦福、MIT、CMU、伯克利。以前这些学校的博士生在硅谷都可以拿到高薪，但是从来没有到250万美元/年的薪资水平。  这为什么会发生呢？ 第一，是因为真正懂深度学习的人现在还不是很多，所以供需不平衡。 第二，是因为很值。Google拿到这样的人，他就可以马上用他赚一百倍的钱。因为你只要把这样的一个人用在某个领域，比如说，假设谷歌要用他手上的现金做最聪明的二级市场的财务投资，这一个人一年就赚出一百倍来，所以这事毫无疑问是划算的。  第三，是因为涉及竞争。Google会很不希望这样的人落入他的竞争对手怀中。因为Google有这样一个领先的优势，但如果这个人去了Facebook、微软，马上就会给后两家机会。所以现在是一个关于人才的战争。对于这一批一年可能少于50个的博士毕业生，这三大公司：Google、Facebook和微软，都在用不合理的价钱去挖。   这给了我两个启示。一方面是遗憾自己生太早了，我就在这个领域，但是那时候没有公司这样来挖我们。另一方面是类似的人才战争，可能也会在中国发生。 中国的大学恐怕没有这样的50个博士，但是我们这边有几所“大学”里毕业的，也是跟硅谷一样的。这几所“大学”的名字叫做腾讯、百度和阿里巴巴。所以这些人未来会不会因为数据的诱惑，或者对公司的忠诚留下来做点事情呢？还是这几家公司之间互挖，可能会成为很有趣的事。

2467449694@chatroom           03/10/2017 10:01:18      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                谁能通俗易懂的解释一下什么叫progressive web apps， 和以前的SPA相比有什么不同？
2467449694@chatroom           03/10/2017 10:03:25      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                我脚的我们在做的就是PWA，兼容多种browser，尤其是mobile
2467449694@chatroom           03/10/2017 10:26:34      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                What is a Progressive Web App? A Progressive Web App is: Progressive - Works for every user, regardless of browser choice because it's built with progressive enhancement as a core tenet. Responsive - Fits any form factor: desktop, mobile, tablet, or whatever is next. Connectivity independent - Enhanced with service workers to work offline or on low-quality networks. App-like - Feels like an app to the user with app-style interactions and navigation because it's built on the app shell model. Fresh - Always up-to-date thanks to the service worker update process. Safe - Served via HTTPS to prevent snooping and to ensure content hasn't been tampered with. Discoverable - Is identifiable as an "application" thanks to W3C manifest and service worker registration scope, allowing search engines to find it. Re-engageable - Makes re-engagement easy through features like push notifications. Installable - Allows users to "keep" apps they find most useful on their home screen without the hassle of an app store. Linkable - Easily share via URL, does not require complex installation.
2467449694@chatroom           03/10/2017 10:26:43      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                这是google的定义。

2467449694@chatroom           03/11/2017 14:51:10      donglin liang            wxid_9mqdtzhl145h12      Receive             Text                有点标题党。DevOps是尽量地使用工具自动化，敏捷才是要求大家以价值，而非技能为导向。你是世界上最好的程序员，但是你在一个做web的公司里写了一个世界上最先进的操作系统，恐怕公司也不会觉得你对公司有什么用处。相反，你去抄了一个php app,为公司创造出两百万的生意，你就是大牛。
2467449694@chatroom           03/11/2017 14:52:20      donglin liang            wxid_9mqdtzhl145h12      Receive             Text                不同公司对开发者的要求是不一样的。

2467449694@chatroom           03/15/2017 18:21:07      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Angular 学习周 Angular 1 蜻蜓点水：  Module, View, Scope, Controller, Directive, Service, Route, Config  周三学  View   What is View?   The view in AngularJS is what exists after AngularJS has compiled and rendered the DOM with all of the JavaScript wiring in place.   What is best practice of developing View?  The controller (discuss in tomorrow) is responsible for providing state for the view and commands that the view can issue back to the controller to do units of work. This frees up the view from having to maintain state (since it only has to display whatever state the controller is in) and it frees up the view from having to do any work (as the view always defers to the controller).  <div ng-app="" ng-init="person={firstName:'Xiaoping',lastName:'Zhou'}">  <p>The name is {{ person.lastName }}</p >  </div>

2467449694@chatroom           03/15/2017 19:33:11      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                AngularJS Expressions vs. JavaScript Expressions  Like JavaScript expressions, AngularJS expressions can contain literals, operators, and variables.  Unlike JavaScript expressions, AngularJS expressions can be written inside HTML.  AngularJS expressions do not support conditionals, loops, and exceptions, while JavaScript expressions do.  AngularJS expressions support filters, while JavaScript expressions do not.

2467449694@chatroom           03/16/2017 18:09:14      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Angular 学习周 Angular 1 蜻蜓点水：  Module, View, Scope, Controller, Directive, Service, Route, Config  周四学  Scope  What is scope?  The scope is the glue between the HTML (view) and the JavaScript (controller).  The scope is an object with properties and methods.  The scope is available for both the view and the controller.   <div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="myCtrl">  <h1>I love {{group}}</h1>  </div>   <script>  var app = angular.module('myApp', []);  app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope) {      $scope.group = "MN IT Wechat Group";  });  </script>  The property "group" was made in the controller, and can be referred to in the view by using the {{ }} brackets.

2467449694@chatroom           03/16/2017 21:33:12      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                     Can Angular deal with nested scope?  Yes     Separate scopes are incredibly useful. As seen in the example above, they allow for different parts of the view to cleanly separate their part of the underlying model. Additionally, child scopes can access properties of their parent properties.
2467449694@chatroom           03/16/2017 21:50:04      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                经典考问: What is difference between rootScope and scope?   $rootScope is available globally, no matter what controller you are in, whereas $scope is only available to the current controller and it's children.  In general, rootScope is avoided unless you need a event bus

2467449694@chatroom           03/17/2017 19:00:35      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                What is controller?  AngularJS applications are controlled by controllers. AngularJS controllers control the data of AngularJS applications.  A controller is only responsible for defining methods and properties on scope so that they’re available to the view.  What is best practice of controller?  Controllers should be as thin as possible.  HTML file:  <div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl">  First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br /> Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br /> <br /> Full Name: {{fullName()}}  </div>  <script src="personController.js"></script>   Javascript file:  personController.js:  var app = angular.module('myApp', []); app.controller('personCtrl', function($scope) {     $scope.firstName = "John";     $scope.lastName = "Doe";     $scope.fullName = function() {         return $scope.firstName + " " + $scope.lastName;     }; });
2467449694@chatroom           03/17/2017 19:02:22      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                上面的 HTML View 和 Controller personCtrl 是通过 scope 联姻的
2467449694@chatroom           03/17/2017 19:05:38      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                昨天小陈大狮说了 scope 麻烦。是的，View 展颜值，Controller 提供物资，媒婆夹在中间干嘛![Silent]
2467449694@chatroom           03/17/2017 19:07:42      10000                    10000                    Receive             System info         "王曉川" has recalled a message.
2467449694@chatroom           03/17/2017 19:08:19      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                那现在看看高人是怎么解决这个问题的。下面程序的两点值得学习领悟，吃透第一点，就上了一台阶，吃透第二点，就更上一层楼。
2467449694@chatroom           03/17/2017 19:10:05      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                (1)    Avoid scope  In AngularJS 1.3, a new convention was introduced for working with controllers known as the controller-as syntax. Instead of declaring a controller on the view as ng-controller="personCtrl", you’d define it as ng-controller ="personCtrl as person". In the view, you’d refer to that controller as person. For instance, if you wanted to bind to someProperty that existed on the controller, it would look like {{person.someProperty}}.  When you use controller-as syntax, you don’t need to inject $scope.     (2)    In controller,  store a top level reference to this, which is a JavaScript pattern to avoid subtle scoping,context,closure,binding issues which can shoot your own foot. (https://alistapart.com/article/getoutbindingsituations)  HTML file:  <div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl as person">  First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="person.firstName"><br /> Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="person.lastName"><br /> <br /> Full Name: {{person.fullName()}}  </div>  <script src="personController.js"></script>   Javascript file:  personController.js:  var app = angular.module('myApp', []); app.controller('personCtrl', function() {    var  person = this;     person.firstName = "John";    person.lastName = "Doe";    person.fullName = function() {         return person.firstName + " " +person.lastName;     }; });

2467449694@chatroom           03/20/2017 14:47:49      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Angular  蜻蜓点水 第二周。 这周专攻 Services, 因为它种类多。  Services are the major workhorses in the AngularJS environment. Services are singleton objects that provide functionality for a web app.  Services provide common functionality to an AngularJS application. For instance, if you have data that more than one controller needs, you would promote that data to a service and then make it available to the controllers via the service.  Constant:   Good for storing simple values that will never need to change.  Value:    Good for storing simple values that may need to change during runtime.  Service:   Creates a service using a constructor method. This is good for developers who prefer OOP-style programming and like using the this keyword.  Factory:   Creates a service using a constructor function. Developers using the Revealing Module pattern will be at home with this style.  Provider:  Provides the most control over defining your service but is more complex and verbose. Good for modifying behavior of a service while the application is being configured
2467449694@chatroom           03/20/2017 14:49:39      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                VALUE SERVICE  is the simplest of all services. The value service method takes two parameters: the name of the service and the value that is to be returned when the value service is instantiated.  StoryService.js:  myModule.value('STORY_TYPES', [ {name: 'Feature'}, {name: 'Enhancement'}, {name: 'Bug'}, {name: 'Spike'} ]);  And we consume STORY_TYPES by injecting it into our StoryController.  StoryController js:  angular.module('Story') .controller('StoryCtrl', function (STORY_TYPES) {  var myStory = this;  myStory.types = STORY_TYPES;   });

2467449694@chatroom           03/21/2017 18:08:15      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Angular  蜻蜓点水 Angular services  有以下几种  Constant:   Good for storing simple values that will never need to change.  Value:    Good for storing simple values that may need to change during runtime.  Service:   Creates a service using a constructor method. This is good for developers who prefer OOP-style programming and like using the this keyword.  Factory:   Creates a service using a constructor function. Developers using the Revealing Module pattern will be at home with this style.  Provider:  Provides the most control over defining your service but is more complex and verbose. Good for modifying behavior of a service while the application is being configured
2467449694@chatroom           03/21/2017 18:08:50      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                昨天点了 Value Service, 今天点 Constant Service
2467449694@chatroom           03/21/2017 18:09:28      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                CONSTANT SERVICE - A constant service is similar to a value service except that it’s available to the module .config block and can’t be modified during runtime. Constant services are especially handy for configuration values that aren’t going to change during the course of the application lifecycle. For instance,  we can use the constant service to define a remote URI like the following:  angular.module('Common') .constant('CURRENT_BACKEND', 'firebase');  This allows us to encapsulate our back-end choice into a single place and pass it around as needed.
2467449694@chatroom           03/21/2017 18:11:07      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                为什么连个 Constant 都要通过 service module  来 expose to other module?

2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 17:07:32      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                今天蜻蜓点水 Angular Services 里最混淆的两个慨念 Service vs Factory. 
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 17:09:31      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                SERVICE CONSTRUCTOR AND SERVICE FACTORY  The most common type of a service is one created by a service constructor or a service factory. We’ll examine these together because the distinction between the two is subtle and really comes down to stylistic preference.  When you define a service using module.service, the instance is returned via a constructor function. This lends itself well to developers who prefer writing object-oriented code and like to define methods and properties on the this keyword.  angular.module('Common') .service('LoadingService', function ($scope) {      var service = this;      service.setLoading = function (loading) {         $scope.loadingView = loading;      }; });   Now we’ll show the same service using module.factory to declare the LoadingService. This works in exactly the same way as the previous service, but it returns an object that exposes methods and properties. This is very similar to the Revealing Module design pattern, in that only the methods and properties that you expose on the return object are publicly accessible.  angular.module(Common') .factory('LoadingService', function ($scope) {      var setLoading = function (loading) {          $scope.loadingView = loading;      };      return { setLoading: setLoading } }); 
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 17:10:35      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                记住这一点就可以了 凡是 Service 能干的， Factory 也能干。
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 17:12:21      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Angular 提供两种模式，是为了讨好两大阵容。 喜欢 OO 的用 Service, 喜欢 Functional 的用 Factory。
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 17:14:23      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                这也体现了 JavaScript 的 flexibility, 左派可以 OO, 右派可以 Functional. 殊途同归! 条条大路通罗马! 神奇的 JavaScript
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 18:37:12      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                @王曉川 你是阶级斗争时刻要警惕，OO都要整个左右
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 18:39:28      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Angular 2 里面就没有左右派了。 Service, Factory 都归并进 component 中
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 20:24:30      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                @王曉川 再解释一下为什么functional的可以用factory，不能用service？
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 20:25:29      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                我看了你的解释似乎factory是static的？value type，不需要instantiate？
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 20:25:53      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                我说的话可能太OO，外行
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 20:32:23      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Factory return an object, the returned object has a function property.  So this object's function can be called directly.  In JavaScript , function can be assigned to a variable.
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 20:33:38      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Angular 的 factory 就是 static class. 可以这么理解
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 20:34:53      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                这个 static factory 的功能就是造 带有 function property 的 object. 
2467449694@chatroom           03/22/2017 20:36:07      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                而 Angular service 模式是 靠 JavaScript OO 的 Function Constructor 来造 Object

2467449694@chatroom           03/23/2017 20:58:32      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                蜻蜓点水 Angular Route  What is Route?  If you want to navigate to different pages in your application, but you also want the application to be a SPA (Single Page Application), with no page reloading, you can use the ngRoute module.  The ngRoute module routes your application to different pages without reloading the entire application.  var app = angular.module("myApp", ["ngRoute"]); app.config(function($routeProvider) {     $routeProvider     .when("/", {         templateUrl : "main.htm"     })     .when("/red", {         templateUrl : "red.htm"     })     .when("/green", {         templateUrl : "green.htm"     })     .when("/blue", {         templateUrl : "blue.htm"     }); });

2467449694@chatroom           03/27/2017 22:38:26      EVZ                      wxid_1sw4loax684h12      Receive             Text                @周常青 你是要 ATDD build on Jenkins?
2467449694@chatroom           03/27/2017 23:10:23      ZCQ                      wxid_aqt5n8xt8d3e12      Receive             Text                @好学 你好，对
2467449694@chatroom           03/27/2017 23:51:48      EVZ                      wxid_1sw4loax684h12      Receive             Text                There are two types of ATDD tests, one type is created only based on Junit and another type is based on both Selenium +Junit. For the first type, put the tests into Maven life cycle, clean install test, create a job item on Jenkins for the test project, set the time, the tests will automatically run on Jenkins when the project is built according to the setting time. For the second type of ATDD, Selenium+Junit, you need a backend web driver on Jenkins instead of GUI web driver such as chrome or Firefox, most popular backend web driver is Phantomjs, to install it on Jenkins, need to do some configuration. Once done, there is an option to let you choose which test you want to run on Jenkins. You are also able to put the tests to Maven life cycle, set time to run them automatically.@周常青 
2467449694@chatroom           03/27/2017 23:53:42      EVZ                      wxid_1sw4loax684h12      Receive             Text                ATDD 通常是 QA create 可以和 development 同时进行

2467449694@chatroom           03/28/2017 23:03:50      EVZ                      wxid_1sw4loax684h12      Receive             Text                @周常青 tradition automated regression test is created by some automated testing scripts or selenium. 现在所说ATDD 都用 framework 实现. 这些 framework 可以帮助完成 continue integration and delivery 这部分，有很多优点. 我只能列出几个主要的方面. 这些framework 不仅提供 API 用于创建 automation test case, 而且提供了 test results even graphic test report. 对 large scale front end project; When Project development is done, need to integrate to external website for example adding digital tags 可以简单快速 create test, easy to maintain; it is easy to build on Jenkins; completely automatic testing release labor; 领导们喜欢：-）

2467449694@chatroom           03/31/2017 20:23:17      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                @IT新兵 Tape 是个新东西？Mocha, Jasmine 目前流行
2467449694@chatroom           03/31/2017 21:25:03      jing                     wxid_q3nj8axe7cvz22      Receive             Text                @王曉川 也有几年了吧？上面这篇文章有很不错的说明。这是其中一段:  As many of you know, I maintain a popular project called the Essential JavaScript Links collection — a one stop shop to find the best JavaScript resources I know. Once in a while somebody will ask me why I don’t list their favorite thing, or the most popular thing.  Sometimes popularity is an indication of quality. Other times, popular things are popular for popularity’s sake, and not because they’re better than alternatives.  On real production projects, I have used Jasmine, Mocha, NodeUnit, Tape, and a bunch of other solutions. I have investigated many other options. For the last few years, I have used and continue to use Tape along with Supertest (for API testing) on all of my personal projects and projects that I lead.  
2467449694@chatroom           03/31/2017 21:25:28      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                好像不是主流
2467449694@chatroom           03/31/2017 21:26:05      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Jasmine 是 job market dominant
2467449694@chatroom           03/31/2017 21:26:23      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                学习一下
2467449694@chatroom           03/31/2017 21:27:08      jing                     wxid_q3nj8axe7cvz22      Receive             Text                What’s Wrong with Mocha, Jasmine, etc…?  Too much configuration: Choose an assertion library, chose a reporting library, chose a task runner (Grunt, Gulp, etc…) Then figure out how to translate the documentation examples to the reporting library / task runner you chose. All of this is too much cognitive load. Vs: Choose Tape. Done.  Globals: Mocha, Jasmine, and several other alternatives pollute the global environment with functions like `describe`, `it`, etc… Some assertion libraries extend built-in prototypes. Aside from removing the self-documenting nature of simple module exports, those decisions could potentially conflict with the code you’re trying to test. Vs: Tape’s simple module export.  Shared State: Functions like `beforeEach` and `afterEach` actively encourage you to do something you definitely should not do: Share state between tests. Vs. Tape: No such functions for global state sharing. Instead, call setup and teardown routines from individual tests, and contain all state to local test variables.  
2467449694@chatroom           03/31/2017 21:29:39      jing                     wxid_q3nj8axe7cvz22      Receive             Text                tape 一己之力就全搞定啦

2467449694@chatroom           04/25/2017 18:41:16      danny liu                wxid_y9xmmxpkvkj012      Receive             Text                @L Chen 应该是cloud native，前两天Winnie的AWSnode掉了，结果要人工启动。cloud native是指在云端预设service group，当一个 group或group 内的node 出状况，会被立即detect和report，根据预设的instructions，一个新的node或group会自动spin up 来响应requests。客户不会察觉出了问题。
2467449694@chatroom           04/25/2017 18:46:32      danny liu                wxid_y9xmmxpkvkj012      Receive             Text                最典型的例子是2014 Christmas，下大雪。很多家庭在家看Netflix，当时只有US east 一个DC，全球的流量超出了可承受范围，Netflix 停了几天。后来他们在 US west和Europe各建一个 DC，就没这个问题了。

2467449694@chatroom           04/25/2017 22:11:57      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                Dim objAccess As Access.Application      Dim strPath As String            On Error Resume Next            Set objAccess = GetObject(, "Access.Application.11")      If objAccess Is Nothing Then           ' Get a reference to the Access Application object         Set objAccess = New Access.Application      End If            strPath = "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\" _      & "Office11\Samples\Northwind.mdb"       ' Open the Northwind database     With objAccess          .OpenCurrentDatabase strPath                    If MsgBox("Do you want to make the Access " & vbCrLf _          & "Application visible?", vbYesNo, _          "Display Access") = vbYes Then              .Visible = True              MsgBox "Notice the Access Application icon " _              & "now appears on the Windows taskbar."          End If           ' Close the database and quit Access         .CloseCurrentDatabase          .Quit      End With      Set objAccess = Nothing  End Sub

2467449694@chatroom           05/11/2017 12:32:53      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                Spies You can use spies to get information on function calls, like how many times they were called, or what arguments were passed to them.
2467449694@chatroom           05/11/2017 12:33:01      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                Stubs Stubs are like spies, but they replace the target function. You can use stubs to control a method's behaviour to force a code path (like throwing errors) or to prevent calls to external resources (like HTTP APIs).
2467449694@chatroom           05/11/2017 12:33:13      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                Mocks A mock is a fake method with a pre-programmed behavior and expectations.
2467449694@chatroom           05/11/2017 12:33:37      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                refer: https://blog.risingstack.com/node-hero-node-js-unit-testing-tutorial/

2467449694@chatroom           05/13/2017 12:55:32      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                什么原因，我忘了。但觉得 Table tr td 更好懂
2467449694@chatroom           05/13/2017 12:57:20      EVZ                      wxid_1sw4loax684h12      Receive             Text                原因可能是 xpath xquery 更容易
2467449694@chatroom           05/13/2017 13:43:24      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                It's mostly about the semantics, I think. A <table> is built to represent tabular data, and using it to lay out elements violates that. Also, anything that can be done with <table> can be done just as easily or easier with CSS 99.9% of the time. It's not that much easier in the other cases, and like you say, it makes markup ugly and hard to follow. It also violates the separation of content, behaviour, and presentation fundamental to web development.
2467449694@chatroom           05/13/2017 13:43:41      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                别人写的，我表示同意，尤其最后一句

2467449694@chatroom           05/22/2017 20:42:03      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                Mule soft 就是以前的 ESB， event driven model,  多用于 enterprise Integration.  它的理念和 Rest  相反，应用范围没有 Rest 广泛

2467449694@chatroom           05/23/2017 18:11:27      jing                     wxid_q3nj8axe7cvz22      Receive             Text                @王军  又是一个忙碌的工作日，没有时间跟临桌聊 robot 他是大忙人，但是跟他的队员聊了不少，大体是这样的： 1. 跟公司的IT 申请一个 Skype ID you like, let's say Robbie 2. 用 Lync API intercept messages sent to Robbie 3. Pass the messages to ms lurs.ai 做语义分析 4. 根据 Lurs.ai 返回的语句意向，做该做的事。  他们用了半天的时间把路走通（1-4），剩下的时间都是在完善。  他们的最终目标是用到Web app 里而不局限在 Skype 里。

2467449694@chatroom           05/25/2017 14:05:19      Huan Gao                 wxid_5qcft6zg1dil12      Receive             Text                HANA是database, 象大家讲的in memory 等，全部用RAM. 另一个原因是以前SAP是用oracle做DB, 下一个version的SAP （S/4 HANA)是用HANA做database, 目前己有finance module.  HANA挺不好用，主要是column based, 有些operation反而会慢一些，其它features和oracle, sqlserver没有太大区别, 也可以写stored procedure等。Cargill用HANA做BI的后台，我们用business object 的Data Services to load data into HANA.

2467449694@chatroom           05/25/2017 22:19:32      王曉川                   wxid_ujm8ijugy71t22      Receive             Text                刚听完 HANA 网课。 技术刚才群主已总结了。 我总结一下网课的讨论。 绝大多数是老印在问问题，老印非常关注它的市场。 HANA 带有很强大的 predictive analysis capability.  由于 SAP backup,  会涌现一批 HANA DBA.  市场缺人，但欢迎Oracle, DB2, SqlServer 的 DBA， 他们转 HANA 比一些 SAP 的功能专家还容易上手。 Logical DBA skill 几乎和 HANA 一样， Physical DBA skill 需要考认证，才会被市场认可

2467449694@chatroom           05/26/2017 12:57:18      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                @Winnie 关于document count的答复，跟我猜的差不多，但是究竟怎么split nested还需要深究。It is because you are using "nested" type in your mapping. At the lowest Lucene level, nested objects are really separate documents from their respective parent document. So the counters in monitoring shows the low level document count which is "total parents + total nested objects". While the Count API shows you only the parent document count.

2467449694@chatroom           06/01/2017 12:10:13      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                加密放在config文件里。
2467449694@chatroom           06/01/2017 12:13:07      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                <connectionStrings configProtectionProvider="RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider">     <EncryptedData Type="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#Element"       xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#">       <EncryptionMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#tripledes-cbc" />       <KeyInfo xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#">         <EncryptedKey xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#">           <EncryptionMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5" />           <KeyInfo xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#">             <KeyName>Rsa Key</KeyName>           </KeyInfo>           <CipherData>             <CipherValue>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</CipherValue>           </CipherData>         </EncryptedKey>       </KeyInfo>       <CipherData>         <CipherValue>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</CipherValue>       </CipherData>     </EncryptedData>   </connectionStrings>
2467449694@chatroom           06/01/2017 12:13:16      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/zhhddkxy.aspx
2467449694@chatroom           06/01/2017 12:22:23      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                谢谢，我用用这个
2467449694@chatroom           06/01/2017 12:22:45      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                triple des是现在还不过时的的加密方法？
2467449694@chatroom           06/01/2017 12:24:52      Lihe Chen                wxid_jt04jpi8gbk321      Receive             Text                我印象里没看到triple des过时的消息

2467449694@chatroom           06/02/2017 12:34:57      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                This is what part of the issue, what happened? Scope of impact - how much data impact by the issue.   Root cause Analysis: Identify nature of code issue, test coverage or data issue so can’t catch in lower environment? Scope detail scenario. What is the propose solution? How much regression testing?   Mitigation Plan: This is work around, if the issue allows to use it. Include who and when to do this, automated or manual.    Root cause fix Plan: If developer assigned working on the issue, when expect to have fix ready for testing, QA team engagement and release coordinator.

2467449694@chatroom           06/04/2017 09:03:02      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                There ain't really nothing that needs to be done as Elasticsearch is pretty much automated in that sense. Also you should not be forcing merge, that API is really target for solving issues.  The only maintenance that is recommended is that you should not keep open indices around if you are not really accessing them. We recommend that you either close or snapshot and delete any index that is not being written to or read from.

2467449694@chatroom           06/07/2017 13:07:45      Dandelion                wxid_wak4ebk9cpdh12      Receive             Text                @王军 “@Winnie 第二句话不太理解，为什么说only force merge to index that no longer be written to，之后又说用cron job每天force merge，不是自相矛盾吗？” - 我是这么理解的：如果那个index变成了write-static了，就可以用forcemerge了。这个要看index是怎么partition的，像我们现在index是 based on timestamp，过了这个时间段就可以forcemerge。For example，the index is 'shipment-2017-06-06'，今天是2017/06/07，那么就可以把shipment-2017-06-06这个index force merge。如果你的index不是按时间分的，而且时不时的会被update，那就最好不要forcemerge。其实我们的index是shipment，但由于volume又被按时间段partition了，forcemerge就很有帮助。

2467449694@chatroom           06/07/2017 19:41:39      Me                       IMG_HAS                  Send                Text                That will only start to make sense if you have a logging analytics like use case, in which you have time based indices (and yet, the real benefits are not that clear as calling force merge is not free). You should only be calling force merge for "yesterday's indices", as he called it. AFAIK you don't have time based indices and my recommendations here was really in the context of your use case. You could be tempted to do it with ".monitoring-*" indices, since they are time based, but I don't see any benefits since:  Calling force merge is not free. It will cost you resources that you should really be using for your business. Also, calculating the cost is nearly impossible and it is not predictable based on a fixed "max_num_segments" because the real segment count in a shard varies a lot. You will mostly benefit, and this is actually highly recommended, to have a single node external cluster for the sole purpose of monitoring. Remember: an external monitoring single node cluster does not count against your subscribed node count (i.e. it is free).
